A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I think all of the negative audience reviews come from the prequel generation who expect Star Wars movies to be nothing but lightsaber duels and cartoonish dialogue. There hasn’t been an episode like this since The Empire Strikes Back which elevated Star Wars into science fiction mastery. The prequels nearly knocked the franchise into buffoonery. Granted Benecio Del Toro was a wasted effort. No major questions were answered. But there’s still a third installment. As sad and tragic as it was\, The Last Jedi was about the passing of the Jedi torch to a new generation. I can’t remember a Star Wars movie that made feel a wide range of emotions. If you want cliche and the “same old-same old” than you won’t like this film. I’m from the Original Trilogy generation so the ending broke my heart. But I respect and love this bold new direction.
